snippet: In a study of Medicare beneficiaries, those who had cataracts surgically removed were less likely to take a serious fall, experiencing 16 percent fewer hip fractures in the year after the operation.
abstract: Study of Medicare beneficiaries finds those who had cataracts surgically removed experienced 16 percent fewer hip fractures in the year after the operation.
lead_paragraph: In a study of Medicare beneficiaries, those who had cataracts surgically removed were less likely to take a serious fall, experiencing 16 percent fewer hip fractures in the year after the operation.

headline.seo: Fewer Hip Fractures Are a Side Benefit of Cataract Surgery, Study Finds
headline.main: Improved Vision After Cataract Surgery Lowers Risk of Broken Hips, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Improved Vision After Cataract Surgery Lowers Risk of Broken Hips, Study Finds
